creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: cylindrical bamboo brush pot carved in high relief; relief is a long poetic inscription by Tung Ch'i-ch'ang, 1555-1636
markings: \'Its clear glow enables one to distinguish vice from virtue. Mountains and rivers--all on the earth are under its covering. Spirits and ghosts flee to the darkness of night.\', in carved high relief at exterior wall; dealer and numbered stickers at underside of base
title: Brush Pot
